text: Proposing we test / consider a Python / Sphinx display output for our .md source files. ... Some folks can set up a test build if there is interest ... Thoughts? <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/1674>
<@U112NNFV4>: I like the format and L&F… question: where would the site be hosted? Do we need resources from LF? This isn’t a problem, just need to understand the requirements
Barry and Ramesh are looking at that; I've attempted to engage Laura Kempke per Sean, but no response from her on Slack. I will try her by email, do you want to be on cc:
should engage <@U0UHG4VP1> (Ry Jones)
<@U0UHG4VP1|ry> has joined the channel
instead of Laura, or in addition to.
instead
ok

<@U112NNFV4>: I commented on 1674. I assume we would end up with something like <http://docs.hyperledger.org/releasename/|docs.hyperledger.org/releasename/> holding the output (or <http://hyperledger.org/docs/releasename|hyperledger.org/docs/releasename>, whatever) and perhaps docs/master being the current work in progress?

<@U112NNFV4>: it’s easy to have a Jenkins job fire on merge to produce the documentation (once someone writes the job). We would need to engage LF’s web team to work out the exact how-to make it ingest the jenkins product

It's a good point on 2 versions: 1 working and 1 "GA" ... However it's done by LF is probably the answer. Ramesh is also interested in continuous delivery - he would have input. <@U11HH3P7Y> ... and btw I created a slack channel just for this issue: "docsdisplay"
